title: How to Make Fake Blood with Chocolate Syrup

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
For this method of fake blood, you'll need:
Hershey's chocolate syrup
Red food coloring
Blue food coloring.

steps.headline: Blend the chocolate syrup and red food coloring.
Add a couple drops of blue food coloring to create a more realistic color.
Put the mixture in the fridge to help it thicken.
Apply liberally, in splatters, droplets and smears.

methods.name: Chocolate syrup and corn syrup fake blood

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
For this method of fake blood, you'll need:
1 tablespoon light corn syrup
1/2 tablespoon chocolate syrup
4 drops red food coloring.

steps.headline: Place the ingredients together in a small mixing bowl.
Use.
steps.description: Decorate yourself (skin, unwanted old clothes, face, etc.). Or, since this is edible, you can add it to food that needs a tinge of fake blood for Halloween.

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
For this method of fake blood, you'll need:
1/2 cup light corn syrup
1-2 drops liquid red food coloring
1 tablespoon cornstarch (helps to thicken and add opacity to the fake blood)
1-2 tablespoons chocolate syrup
1 teaspoon cocoa powder (or drinking chocolate).

steps.headline: Place the ingredients together in a small mixing bowl.
Use.
steps.description: Decorate yourself (skin, unwanted old clothes, face, etc.). Or, since this is edible, you can add it to food that needs a tinge of fake blood for Halloween.

methods.name: Chocolate syrup and tropical punch fake blood

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
For this method of fake blood, you'll need:
1/2 cup tropical fruit punch (or a cup of coffee if you'd like to experiment)
1 cup corn syrup
2 tablespoons red food coloring
1 tablespoon chocolate syrup
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1 tablespoon cocoa powder.

steps.headline: Drop all of the ingredients into a blender.
Check the color.
steps.description: You may need to adjust a little, depending on the brand of fruit punch you've added. Try different amounts of punch, chocolate syrup or cocoa powder until it's just right for your needs.

steps.headline: Use.
steps.description: Decorate yourself (skin, unwanted old clothes, face, etc.). Or, since this is edible, you can add it to food that needs a tinge of fake blood for Halloween.

tyn: Applicator (such as an ear-bud, craft stick, etc.) (optional)
text:
Chocolate syrup fake blood Gather the ingredients. For this method of fake blood, you'll need:
Hershey's chocolate syrup
Red food coloring
Blue food coloring. Blend the chocolate syrup and red food coloring.  Add a couple drops of blue food coloring to create a more realistic color.  Put the mixture in the fridge to help it thicken.  Apply liberally, in splatters, droplets and smears.  Chocolate syrup and corn syrup fake blood Gather the ingredients. For this method of fake blood, you'll need:
1 tablespoon light corn syrup
1/2 tablespoon chocolate syrup
4 drops red food coloring. Place the ingredients together in a small mixing bowl. Stir to combine. Use. Decorate yourself (skin, unwanted old clothes, face, etc.). Or, since this is edible, you can add it to food that needs a tinge of fake blood for Halloween. Chocolate syrup thicker fake blood Gather the ingredients. For this method of fake blood, you'll need:
1/2 cup light corn syrup
1-2 drops liquid red food coloring
1 tablespoon cornstarch (helps to thicken and add opacity to the fake blood)
1-2 tablespoons chocolate syrup
1 teaspoon cocoa powder (or drinking chocolate). Place the ingredients together in a small mixing bowl. Stir to combine. Use. Decorate yourself (skin, unwanted old clothes, face, etc.). Or, since this is edible, you can add it to food that needs a tinge of fake blood for Halloween. Chocolate syrup and tropical punch fake blood Gather the ingredients. For this method of fake blood, you'll need:
1/2 cup tropical fruit punch (or a cup of coffee if you'd like to experiment)
1 cup corn syrup
2 tablespoons red food coloring
1 tablespoon chocolate syrup
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1 tablespoon cocoa powder. Drop all of the ingredients into a blender. Blend for 10 seconds. Check the color. You may need to adjust a little, depending on the brand of fruit punch you've added. Try different amounts of punch, chocolate syrup or cocoa powder until it's just right for your needs. Use. Decorate yourself (skin, unwanted old clothes, face, etc.). Or, since this is edible, you can add it to food that needs a tinge of fake blood for Halloween.
sentences: Chocolate syrup fake blood Gather the ingredients.

For this method of fake blood, you'll need:
Hershey's chocolate syrup
Red food coloring
Blue food coloring.
Blend the chocolate syrup and red food coloring.
Add a couple drops of blue food coloring to create a more realistic color.
Put the mixture in the fridge to help it thicken.
Apply liberally, in splatters, droplets and smears.
Chocolate syrup and corn syrup fake blood Gather the ingredients.

For this method of fake blood, you'll need:
1 tablespoon light corn syrup
1/2 tablespoon chocolate syrup
4 drops red food coloring.
Place the ingredients together in a small mixing bowl.
Stir to combine.
Use.
Decorate yourself (skin, unwanted old clothes, face, etc.).
Or, since this is edible, you can add it to food that needs a tinge of fake blood for Halloween.
Chocolate syrup thicker fake blood Gather the ingredients.

For this method of fake blood, you'll need:
1/2 cup light corn syrup
1-2 drops liquid red food coloring
1 tablespoon cornstarch (helps to thicken and add opacity to the fake blood)
1-2 tablespoons chocolate syrup
1 teaspoon cocoa powder (or drinking chocolate).
Place the ingredients together in a small mixing bowl.
Stir to combine.
Use.
Decorate yourself (skin, unwanted old clothes, face, etc.).
Or, since this is edible, you can add it to food that needs a tinge of fake blood for Halloween.
Chocolate syrup and tropical punch fake blood Gather the ingredients.

For this method of fake blood, you'll need:
1/2 cup tropical fruit punch (or a cup of coffee if you'd like to experiment)
1 cup corn syrup
2 tablespoons red food coloring
1 tablespoon chocolate syrup
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1 tablespoon cocoa powder.
Drop all of the ingredients into a blender.
Blend for 10 seconds.
Check the color.
You may need to adjust a little, depending on the brand of fruit punch you've added.
Try different amounts of punch, chocolate syrup or cocoa powder until it's just right for your needs.
Use.
Decorate yourself (skin, unwanted old clothes, face, etc.).
Or, since this is edible, you can add it to food that needs a tinge of fake blood for Halloween.
